title: Feature request : make slices the python way
body:
Go is almost perfect. Working with Go daily for 6 months, this is a typical pattern that we use all the time and would make LOTS of programmers super happy

Having

type A struct {
   name string
}

going from []A to the slice of the names, I have to write:
 
    var objs []A
    ...
    names := make([]string, 0, len(objs))
    for _, obj := range objs {
      names = append(names, obj.name)
   }

when we could just have 

    names := []string[obj.name for _, obj := range objs]

or some similar syntax

Thanks for taking this into consideration!



Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
1.7.1

### What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
OS X, amd64
